ARABIC: لَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ نَصْرَهُمْ وَهُمْ لَهُمْ جُندٌ مُّحْضَرُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They cannot help them even though they are an army mobilised in their support.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: They will not be able to help them and will be brought (to Us) as their levied troops.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Those deities can render them no help. Yet these devotees act as though they were an army in waiting for them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Instead, the disbelievers will be brought into the presence of God as the soldiers of the idols.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: They (the appointed Gods) cannot help them; and they and their armies will come (to Us), as captives.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: They cannot help them, but they will be brought forward as a troop (against those who worshipped them).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: (But) they shall not be able to assist them, and they shall be a host brought up before them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: They cannot help them, though they be hosts made ready for them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: It is not in their power to help them; but they (the worshippers) are unto them a host in arms.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: but they are not able to help them: rather they will be brought before God as their allied host.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: They are not able to give them succour; whereas they shall be against them host brought forward.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: [But] they cannot help them, while they [themselves] are an army mobilized for their defence.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: They have not the power to help them: but they will be brought up (before Our Judgment-seat) as a troop (to be condemned).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: They cannot help them, but they will be brought forward as a troop against those who worshipped them (at the time of Reckoning).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: They cannot help them, for them (the socalled) army are brought (with them to Hell).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: They cannot help them, although they are arrayed as troops for them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: They are not able to help them, and they [themselves] are for them soldiers in attendance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [36:75] They, their gods, cannot help them — they are being treated as [though they were] rational beings — and they, their idol gods, are their host, as they claim, their supporters, ever-present, [but] in the Fire, together   with them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (It is not in their power to help them) the idols are unable to save them from Allah's chastisement; (but they) i.e. the disbelievers of Mecca (are unto them) in falsehood (a host in arms) like slaves standing before the idols.
